result.execSummary:
The defendant Derry D Essie Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Electric Weapon, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.295(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber for wok and or treatment. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
9:51 AM Defendant Derry D Essie Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Derry D Essie Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Warrant stayed from last date. 
Atty Ramirez indicates the defendant is sitting on child support and will be consolidating. 
Court indicates if the parties are prepared he will do everything today. 
Parties go off the record for Atty Ramirez to go through the plea form. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 
Amended information filed today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: Cts 1 & 2 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 21CT332 will also be dismissed and read in.
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 60 days Racine County Jail, Huber for work and treatment. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.
$Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, payment plan $25/month beginning 12/1/22.

Return to sender - Attempted not known; unable to forward.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: ***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derry D Essie Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Derry D Essie Jr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
